thread.title: Stop chewing tobacco, say California politicians
thread.title_full: Stop chewing tobacco, say California politicians

title: Stop chewing tobacco, say California politicians
text:
Stop chewing tobacco, say California politicians By John Rogers APOctober 14, 2015, 12:02 am TWN SHARE Tweet LOS ANGELES -- California lawmakers have taken the first step toward accomplishing something Major League Baseball could never do: Stop players from stuffing those big wads of chewing tobacco into their mouths during games. 
With California Governor Jerry Brown signing a bill earlier this week banning the use of smokeless tobacco in all California ballparks, the practice now seems headed toward the sport's endangered species list. 
California has five Major League teams and owners themselves have been pressing for a ban for years. Last May they got one in San Francisco. In August they got another in Boston. And when Brown signed Assembly Bill 768 on Sunday one was already in the works for Los Angeles. 
Major League Baseball still needs buy-in from the players, however, because the statewide ban that takes effect before next season has no provision for enforcement. SHARE
